column5: Hey everyone, hope the weekend was as good to everyone as it was to me.  Unfortunately, I had to miss the Fishing For Tyler event on Saturday but I hear it was a great turnout and I'm glad to see the event not only going strong, but growing strong.  I managed to sneak out for a few hours in the afternoon but I should have stayed home.  Went 0/2 and must have put 20 miles on the sled. I was supposed to meet a friend this morning at 7am, but when my alarm went off this morning only a couple hours after getting home from watching UFC 127, I wasnt exactly feeling it.  After a hot drink, i felt up to the challenge and I departed.  We met up at BBP and took the sled for a ride.  Not many people around at the first waypoint so we set up shop and never moved.  We could only fish until 1230 so we had to make the most of our day.  It was 820 before we were set up out there and within 5 minutes I had a fat humpback on the ice, it was a bleeder so he's going to the smoker.  Over the next 4 hours, we experienced our best day in a while out there!  With such a tough February season, it was nice to end it with a bang! Final tally was 15 lakers and 2 whities landed.  Cal lost probably the biggest laker I've seen personally on Simcoe.  He got it up to about 10 feet where we got a good glimpse of it before peeling right back down to bottom where the fish popped out on a headshake.  I put that fish at 20-25 pounds, it was so devastating, and talk about a broken record for this season.  Got the fish on a variety of baits although the Stinger and a smoke/purple slammer did most of the damage today.
Looks like you had an awesome day. Too bad about the huge one that got away but it gives you a good reason to go back out to try to get him next time!

Great day out Steve!  Man i lost a measly 10-15lb....and i was peeved....i would have been near devasted to see and not land a 20lber...oh well....at least you know there's a big one in there   Thanks for posting....great pics BTW.
Nice Steve. Knew i shoulda gone back out today.
Absolutely.... hope we hook one again soon!
Great report Steve. Those lakers are nice n fat.... wouldn't mind one myself this year.
Man !!! You were dialed in on them for sure !!! Nice catch.
Lots of nice fish. You know where to find them
Great report man!  I've iced one laker on Simcoe this year, I think I need to change that
Nicely done, Steve!!  I've hit Simcoe twice this year, chasers, but, no takers.
Nice Lakers and that's a nice sized white fish. Looks like a good time.
Another great fishing post there Steve Might have missed a big one but lots of good quality lakers.
